trans-unit.source: In this step, you add an FTP source to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you add an FTP source to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: An FTP source component on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface represents a location on the FTP Server where Northwind Traders drops the flat-file message to send to Humongous Insurance.
trans-unit.target: An FTP source component on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface represents a location on the FTP Server where Northwind Traders drops the flat-file message to send to Humongous Insurance.

trans-unit.source: The FTP Server from where a bridge picks a message must be in a public domain and must allow connections in either secure (SSL) or non-secure mode.
trans-unit.target: The FTP Server from where a bridge picks a message must be in a public domain and must allow connections in either secure (SSL) or non-secure mode.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, open the <token>msgflow</token> surface, right-click anywhere on <token>msgflow</token> surface, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, open the <token>msgflow</token> surface, right-click anywhere on <token>msgflow</token> surface, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.

trans-unit.source: This is the name that you provided in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> while provisioning the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the name that you provided in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> while provisioning the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop an <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> component onto the surface.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop an <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> component onto the surface.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides information about the properties:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides information about the properties:

trans-unit.source: Specify the character encoding of the message.
trans-unit.target: Specify the character encoding of the message.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, retain the default.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, retain the default.

trans-unit.source: Specify Text or XML as the message file type.
trans-unit.target: Specify Text or XML as the message file type.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, retain the default.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, retain the default.

trans-unit.source: Specify a unique and descriptive name of the FTP Source component.
trans-unit.target: Specify a unique and descriptive name of the FTP Source component.

trans-unit.source: Specify a File Mask to filter the messages pulled from the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Specify a File Mask to filter the messages pulled from the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Specify the folder on the FTP server that contains the messages to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: Specify the folder on the FTP server that contains the messages to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, Humongous Insurance pulls all the messages from a <embeddedLabel>ReceiveFFMessage</embeddedLabel> folder on the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, Humongous Insurance pulls all the messages from a <embeddedLabel>ReceiveFFMessage</embeddedLabel> folder on the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Specify <embeddedLabel>Binary</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>ASCII</embeddedLabel> as the mode of transfer.
trans-unit.target: Specify <embeddedLabel>Binary</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>ASCII</embeddedLabel> as the mode of transfer.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, retain the default.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, retain the default.

trans-unit.source: Specify <embeddedLabel>Stop</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Start</embeddedLabel> for the FTP Source.
trans-unit.target: Specify <embeddedLabel>Stop</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Start</embeddedLabel> for the FTP Source.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, retain the default.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, retain the default.

trans-unit.source: If set to <embeddedLabel>Start</embeddedLabel>, the FTP Source component is started when the <token>msgflow_proj</token> is deployed.
trans-unit.target: If set to <embeddedLabel>Start</embeddedLabel>, the FTP Source component is started when the <token>msgflow_proj</token> is deployed.

trans-unit.source: If the initial status is set to <embeddedLabel>Stop</embeddedLabel>, you can set it to <embeddedLabel>Start</embeddedLabel> even after the project (which includes the bridge, artifacts, and the FTP source) has been deployed.
trans-unit.target: If the initial status is set to <embeddedLabel>Stop</embeddedLabel>, you can set it to <embeddedLabel>Start</embeddedLabel> even after the project (which includes the bridge, artifacts, and the FTP source) has been deployed.

trans-unit.source: <token>af_integration</token> provides PowerShell cmdlets to start sources for a <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: <token>af_integration</token> provides PowerShell cmdlets to start sources for a <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the username password that can retrieve files from the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username password that can retrieve files from the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name or IP address of the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name or IP address of the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Default is 21 and is typically used for FTP.
trans-unit.target: Default is 21 and is typically used for FTP.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> if the connection to the FTP server must use SSL.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> if the connection to the FTP server must use SSL.

trans-unit.source: Enter the username that can retrieve files from the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username that can retrieve files from the FTP server.
